ep.desc: COGNITIO'26 presents an exciting opportunity to test your mettle through the ELEVATOR PITCH event. Participants will present their unique ideas aligned with Mechamorph and showcase a comprehensive B-PLAN. This plan should include market research, competitor analysis, USP, revenue model, investments required, and marketing strategy. Students will be judged based on these parameters, along with any other relevant points they include.

details2.heading: ROUND 1: IDEA SUBMISSION
points: This will be a submission round. All teams must submit their business ideas in PPT format.
Maximum number of slides permitted is 10 (Exclusive of Cover Page).
Top 10 teams will advance to the next round.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: IDEA PITCHING
points: Selected teams from Round 1 will pitch their ideas before the judges.
Time limit of the presentation is 20 minutes.
Presentation will be followed by questions from the judges.

ep.name: ELEVATOR PITCH

quiriosity.desc: Mechamorph - the art of mechanical transformation - is a crucial element in the design and development process. This year's Quriosity will be on Mechamorph. To all the quiz geeks out there, brace yourself and be ready for your quizzing mettle to be tested. It is the time to compete with the finest brains of the institute and enrich your quizzing skills. QURIOSITY provides a platform to explore the charm of science and technology. To come up as a winner, you need to possess noetic and quick thinking.
details1: Number of students in a team: 2

details2.heading: ROUND 1
points: Pen and paper-based preliminary test

details2.heading: ROUND 2
points: 6 Teams will be selected on-spot from the prelims for the final quiz competition.

quiriosity.name: QURIOSITY

dictumSymposium.desc: Greatest quality of a leader is wisdom of opinion and way of expression. COGNITIO '26 brings you the opportunity to get into the war of words. Buckle up, for this is the event you craved for. Let your larynx vibrate and your words echo the whole house. DICTUM SYMPOSIUM brings all of you the experience of speaking as a leader. The event deals with expression of opinion/defending your stand on corporate issues by highlighting its social, economic, environmental, and technical impacts.
details1: Number of students in a team: 2

details2.heading: ROUND 1: ABSTRACT SUBMISSION
points: Describing your views on one of the prescribed topics.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: EXTEMPORE TOPICS
points: Topics will be provided on spot and the team members have to present their views on the same.

details2.heading: ROUND 3: DEBATE
points: Topics will be provided beforehand. 2 teams have to debate with each other with the members of each team speaking alternatively.

dictumSymposium.name: DICTUM SYMPOSIUM

sas.desc: COGNITIO '26 presents SHOOT AT SIGHT - where physics takes flight and precision decides victory. Propulsion, aerodynamics, and strategy come together in this thrilling technical event. Participants will design and launch a water rocket using fundamental principles of kinematics and fluid mechanics. Accuracy, range, and consistency are the ultimate goals - miss the mark and you're out.
details1: Number of students in a team: 3

details2.heading: ROUND 1: WRITTEN TEST
points: A written test involving concepts of kinematics, aerodynamics, propulsion, and hydraulics.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: ROCKET FABRICATION & LAUNCH
points: Teams will build their water rocket using self-brought materials and launch it under the supervision of event coordinators.

details2.heading: ROUND 3: FINAL LAUNCH
points: Each team will get three chances to launch their rocket. The maximum range achieved out of the three attempts will be considered for final evaluation.

sas.name: SHOOT AT SIGHT

robowar.desc: COGNITIO '26 presents ROBO WAR - where machines clash and engineering meets aggression. Gear up to witness raw power, precision, and strategy collide in an ultimate battle of bots. Design, build, and unleash your combat robot to dominate the arena. Only the toughest machines and smartest minds survive this war.

details2.heading: ROUND 1: ABSTRACT SUBMISSION
points: Submission of bot design, weapon mechanism, drive system, and combat strategy.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: DESIGN & FABRICATION
points: Teams will fabricate their robots using the provided kit and allowed additional materials.

details2.heading: ROUND 3: ARENA BATTLE
points: Robots will fight head-to-head in knockout matches until a winner emerges.

robowar.name: ROBOWAR

cultural night.desc: COGNITIO '26 brings you CULTURAL NIGHT - a celebration beyond engineering. After days of competition and innovation, it's time to let loose. Music, dance, energy, and vibes - Cultural Night is where talent takes the spotlight and memories are made.
details1: Performances include: Dance, Music, Drama, Open Mic

details2.heading: Event Flow
points: Performances will be shortlisted based on registrations and rehearsals.

cultural night.name: CULTURAL NIGHT

lockItIn.desc: COGNITIO '26 presents LOCK IT IN - where strategy meets spontaneity and only the sharpest minds survive. Quick thinking, coordination, and competitive spirit collide in this high-energy multi-round showdown. LOCK IT IN is not just a game - it's a battle of wit, reflex, and tactical brilliance. From cracking fun challenges to strategic face-offs and an electrifying final sprint, every round eliminates the weak and sharpens the strong. Only those who think fast, adapt faster, and stay locked under pressure will claim victory.
details1: Number of students in a team: 3

details2.heading: ROUND 1: FUN QUIZ
points: An exciting and dynamic quiz round designed to test general awareness, logical thinking, pop culture knowledge, and spontaneous problem-solving.
Teams must "lock in" their answers within limited time - hesitation could cost qualification.
Only the top-performing teams move forward.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: BLIND KILL
points: Strategy takes center stage.

Qualified teams will enter a tactical face-off where they must choose to attack or defend against competing teams. Decisions must be made with limited information, testing coordination, deception skills, and game sense.
Every move counts - one wrong call and you're eliminated.
Only the smartest survivors advance.

details2.heading: ROUND 3: FUN RACE (THE FINAL SHOWDOWN)
points: The ultimate challenge of speed, teamwork, and presence of mind.
Finalist teams will compete in an exhilarating fun race filled with surprise tasks and mini-obstacles.
Energy, communication, and execution will decide who crosses the finish line first and locks in the crown.

lockItIn.name: LOCK IT IN

assemblage.desc: Strength of mechanical models and engineering structures is an important area of study and experimentation. Concept and principles dealing with truss systems, beam loadings, stress-strain calculation and representation are imperative for evaluating the failure point of structures. Also, the knowledge of material science and vibration is essential to understand the mechanical behaviors and dynamics of the system under consideration. This event deals with fabrication of a bridge model and its strength testing using varied types of loads.
details1: Number of students in a team: 3
The team has to construct a bridge model.
Required materials will be provided on spot.
The structure will be tested under loads of different nature and value and corresponding points will be awarded.

details2.heading: ROUND 1
points: Written test on related concepts

details2.heading: ROUND 2
points: Conceptual Design submission, Bridge Model construction, Strength Testing.

assemblage.name: ASSEMBLAGE

Cansys.desc: COGNITIO '26 brings you CANSYS - where design meets analysis. Turn imagination into reality using CAD and CAE tools. This event tests your ability to design, analyze, and justify your model under real-world engineering constraints. Precision, logic, and software skills are the keys to victory.
details1: Number of students in a team: 2

details2.heading: ROUND 1: PROBLEM STATEMENT
points: A design problem will be given on the spot.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: CAD MODELLING
points: Participants must create a 3D model using SolidWorks/CATIA.

details2.heading: ROUND 3: ANALYSIS
points: Structural analysis using ANSYS followed by evaluation of results and calculations.

Cansys.name: CANSYS

placestation.desc: Do you consider yourself an all-rounder? Do you have a unique way of accomplishing goals? Do you stand out in a crowd? Come enter this corporate labyrinth, where one can live and experience the nerve-wracking placement session in a real-time dynamic environment with a series of stations comprising of the comprehensive written test, expressive group discussion as you make your way through the maze to the final round which is the personal interview. It's an all-round competitive event with a motive to guide the students about campus placements and at the same time select the best. So if you think you've got what it takes to make a mark, then do come and be a part of this grand event.

details2.heading: ROUND 1
points: Written Test involving aptitude, logical reasoning, and technical questions. (Core and Analytics)
Written Test involving aptitude, logical reasoning, and coding questions. (SDE)

details2.heading: ROUND 2
points: Group Discussion on practical and abstract topics (Core)
Personal Interview - Technical (Analytics and SDE)

details2.heading: ROUND 3
points: Personal Interview – Technical and HR (Core)
Personal Interview – HR (Analytics and SDE)

placestation.name: PLACE STATION

posterPresentation.desc: COGNITIO ’26 presents POSTER PRESENTATION — where ideas speak louder than words. A platform to showcase innovation, research, and creativity through visual storytelling. Present your ideas, defend your concepts, and leave an impact with clarity and confidence.
details1: Number of students in a team: 2

details2.heading: ROUND 1: ABSTRACT SUBMISSION
points: Submission of abstract based on prescribed themes.

details2.heading: ROUND 2: POSTER PRESENTATION AND PROTOTYPING
points: Participants will present their posters and prototype and explain their concepts to the judges.

details2.heading: ROUND 3: QUESTION & ANSWER
points: Evaluation based on understanding, presentation skills, and originality.

posterPresentation.name: POSTER PRESENTATION
